meanings.definition: Relating to or situated at the top or apex; highest; uppermost.
meanings.sent1: The cacuminal part of the mountain was covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: The flag fluttered at the cacuminal point of the pole.
meanings.sent3: The cat climbed to the cacuminal shelf and couldn't find its way down.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams reached the cacuminal heights of success.
meanings.sent5: The cacuminal star shone brightly in the night sky.

meanings.definition: Pronounced with the tip of the tongue against the hard palate.
meanings.sent1: The cacuminal sound of 't' is made by touching the tip of the tongue to the roof of the mouth.
meanings.sent2: The pronunciation guide explained how to make the cacuminal 'k' sound.
meanings.sent3: The cacuminal speech exercise made everyone giggle in class.
meanings.sent4: Her cacuminal accent reminded him of home.
meanings.sent5: The cacuminal click of the camera captured the moment perfectly.
